description.narrative:
The project aims to strengthen the role of young parliamentarians as advocate of the youth socio-economic rights through educate and sensitize them on youth SRH and life skills issues and to mobilize them to create favourable environment for youth to practice their rights. Project will also increase the capabilities of youth (age 18-29) at local level to better recognize and enjoy their socio-economic rights. Project will also contribute in the sustainable socio and economic development by providing advanced skill building opportunities to the poor rural youth including women and TGs of BISP communities through public -private partnership. Concept ofgender inclusive skill economic development and decent wages would be promoted through awareness raising and liaising with potential employers. Long term Impact: Empowered youth (women, men and transgender )of age 18-29 in Sindh and Punjab have increased accessto socio-economic rights(SRH, right to work) in an enabling environment
Out Comes: 1. Capacitated young parliamentarian negotiate on policy reforms (SRH related and youth economic development policies) with relevant government bodies to create enabling environment for youth (men, women, transgender) 2. Trained BISP youth(men, women and TG) from respective constituencies of YP on LSE have thecapabilities to practice their SRH rights in favourable environment 3. Youth (men, women and TGs) from BISP communities have accessto long term sustainable employment opportunities to enhance their livelihood

participating-org.narrative: College of Youth Activism & Develop Pakistan

Young people constitute the largest segment of the Pakistani population and around 67% of them are between 15-35 years of age. Our youth is currently facing the most formidable challenges that they are not equipped to deal with. This is particularly true for people belonging to remote areas of Pakistan (e.g. in Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). In the wake of this predicament, CYAAD is making a difference by filling the void to repel the darkness that lies deep within our society. CYAAD works with young men and women who are in dire need of social and technical guidance to carve a bright future for themselves. The creation of CYAAD is a bold step to empower Pakistani youth by providing them with opportunities of education, technical training and broad scale engagement. CYAAD isdedicated to make a contribution for poverty alleviation, positive local engagement of our youth in the political system, impartingeducation and technical training to encourage entrepreneurship and social development, as well as to counter extremism and radicalization (leading to ethnic and religious intolerance).
